abstract: Fed Chairman Ben S. Bernanke said Americans are likely to let short-term events shape their long-term perceptions about price increases.
snippet: Fed Chairman Ben S. Bernanke said Americans are likely to let short-term events shape their long-term perceptions about price increases.
lead_paragraph: Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, said today that Americans have less erratic expectations about inflation than they used to but are still likely to let short-term events shape their long-term perceptions about price increases.
